entitymodel.title: Entity of an Apache OFBiz Component

entity.title: Order Adjustment Entity
entity.description: Note that both includeInTax and includeInShipping should default to true, except in the case where this adjustment is a tax or shipping adjustment then should be ignored.

field.name: amountAlreadyIncluded
field.description: The amount here is already represented in the price, such as VAT taxes.

field.name: sourcePercentage
field.description: for tax entries this is the tax percentage

field.name: customerReferenceId
field.description: for tax entries this is partyTaxId

field.name: primaryGeoId
field.description: for tax entries this is the primary jurisdiction Geo (the smallest or most local Geo that this tax is for, usually a state/province, perhaps a county or a city)

field.name: secondaryGeoId
field.description: for tax entries this is the secondary jurisdiction Geo (usually a country, or other Geo that the primary is within)

field.name: exemptAmount
field.description: an amount that would normally apply, but not to this order; for tax exemption represents the what the tax would have been

field.name: taxAuthGeoId
field.description: these taxAuth fields deprecate the primaryGeoId and secondaryGeoId fields and will be used with the newer tax calc stuff

field.name: overrideGlAccountId
field.description: used to specify the override or actual glAccountId used for the adjustment, avoids problems if configuration changes after initial posting, etc

field.name: originalAdjustmentId
field.description: specifies relation to source OrderAdjustment - eg. for tax on shipping charges

field.name: priority
field.description: Sets priority for Inventory Reservation

field.name: pickSheetPrintedDate
field.description: This will be set to a date when pick sheet of the order is printed

field.name: cancelBackOrderDate
field.description: Used to cancel all orders from suppliers when its in past

field.name: overrideGlAccountId
field.description: Used to specify the override or actual glAccountId used for the adjustment, avoids problems if configuration changes after initial posting, etc.

field.name: vendorPartyId
field.description: For use with multi-vendor stores, order will be split so that each ship group is associated with only one vendor (only if applicable)

field.name: priority
field.description: Sets priority for Inventory Reservation

field.name: finAccountId
field.description: For paying with a fin account instead of payment method on file

field.name: securityCode
field.description: NOTE: THIS SHOULD NEVER BE PERSISTED OUTSIDE THE SCOPE OF A SINGLE TRANSACTION, TYPICALLY ONLY FOR AUTHORIZATION PURPOSES, SHOULD BE REMOVED IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING USE; this is the 3 digit on back (for Visa, MC, etc) or 4 digit on front (Amex, etc) card verification code; also note that this field is longer than needed to accommodate encryption.

field.name: track2

entity.title: Quote Adjustment Entity
entity.description: Note that both includeInTax and includeInShipping should default to true, except in the case where this adjustment is a tax or shipping adjustment then should be ignored.

field.name: custRequestDate
field.description: When the customer (or whoever) submitted the request, maybe out of OFBiz : comming by mail, email, etc.

field.name: responseRequiredDate
field.description: responseRequiredDate is the time the customer needs a response.

field.name: fulfillContactMechId
field.description: Field to support a location of a cust request--ie, product literature sent to an address, service call at a localtion, etc.

field.name: openDateTime
field.description: Used when the customer service person, or anyone assigned to handle the incoming request, opens it for action. You cantake the customer requestdate and openDateTime to see the efficiency of the customer service people.

field.name: closedDateTime
field.description: Used when the customer service person, or anyone assigned to handle the incoming request, closes it as resolution. In some customer response systems, the openDateTime and closedDateTime can happen more than once as the customer is not satified with the resolution.

field.name: createdDate
field.description: When it is actually stored in the system.

field.name: lastModifiedDate
field.description: Last modified date can be till the closedDateTime which is when the customer service people, or anyone assigned to handle the incoming request, says it is resolved. This gives when the last action was done to see if the steps to resolve the request are happening in a timely manner.

entity.title: Cust Request Item Work Effort Entity

field.name: partyId
field.description: party or party group(via partyRelationShip entity) responsible for responding to the communication request of this particular type

entity.title: Return Adjustment Entity
entity.description: Tax, shipping, and promotional adjustments which are carried over from the order to the return. Note that both includeInTax and includeInShipping should default to true, except in the case where this adjustment is a tax or shipping adjustment then should be ignored.

field.name: returnTypeId
field.description: actually used for disbursement type: store credit, cash refund, exchange

field.name: sourcePercentage
field.description: for tax entries this is the tax percentage

field.name: customerReferenceId
field.description: for tax entries this is partyTaxId

field.name: primaryGeoId
field.description: for tax entries this is the primary jurisdiction Geo (the smallest or most local Geo that this tax is for, usually a state/province, perhaps a county or a city)

field.name: secondaryGeoId
field.description: for tax entries this is the secondary jurisdiction Geo (usually a country, or other Geo that the primary is within)

field.name: exemptAmount
field.description: an amount that would normally apply, but not to this order; for tax exemption represents the what the tax would have been

field.name: taxAuthGeoId
field.description: these taxAuth fields deprecate the primaryGeoId and secondaryGeoId fields and will be used with the newer tax calc stuff

field.name: overrideGlAccountId
field.description: used to specify the override or actual glAccountId used for the adjustment, avoids problems if configuration changes after initial posting, etc

field.name: returnReasonId
field.description: why item is returned: did not like, wrong item, damaged, etc. etc.

field.name: returnTypeId
field.description: actually used for disbursement type: store credit, cash refund, exchange

field.name: returnItemTypeId
field.description: what is returned: a product, a service, etc

field.name: productId
field.description: we need this field to be able to figure out net sales of a product

field.name: returnQuantity
field.description: promised by the customer

field.name: receivedQuantity
field.description: actually received from the customer

entity.title: The Return Item Response Entity
entity.description: Records what was done with a return: whether a replacement order, a payment, or a billing account credit was issued

entity.title: Return Item Type Entity
entity.description: ReturnItemType records the type of a ReturnItem

entity.title: Return Item Type Map Entity
entity.description: Mapping between productTypeId and returnItemTypeId for product order items, orderItemTypeId and returnItemTypeId for other order items, or orderAdjustmentTypeId and returnAdjustmentTypeId. Separate mappings for different types of returns (customer vs. vendor)

entity.title: Records the quantity and amount returned to an inventory item from a return item.
Return Item And Shipment Association Entity
